title: Installation issue: dftbplus
body:
## DFTB+ (dftbplus) package installation Issue
I found a problem with `dftbplus@19.1` package installation issue. The problem is that the `dftbplus` package github repository uses the `git submodule` for many important parts of the package in the `/external/` folder, including `mpifx`, `mbd`, `fytest` and `libnegf` which is not included in the package release `19.1.tar.gz` file. 

To check that issue, you may find that `/external/mpifx/origin` folder in the `19.1.tar.gz` file downloaded from link [https://github.com/dftbplus/dftbplus/archive/19.1.tar.gz](https://github.com/dftbplus/dftbplus/archive/19.1.tar.gz) is empty. On the [dftbplus github repository](https://github.com/dftbplus/dftbplus.git), it is liked to another submodule.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

<!-- Fill in the exact spec you are trying to build and the relevant part of the error message -->
```console
$ spack install dftbplus +arpack +dftd3 +mpi +sockets +transport +elsi
```


### Ways to Fix This Problem
**I found one way to fix this problem**, by editing the `dftbplus` package file in `spack` and now using the github repository so it can download the `git submodule` automatically. 

**Replace** the following original code in `$spack edit dftbplus` 
```
    url      = "https://github.com/dftbplus/dftbplus/archive/19.1.tar.gz"
    version('19.1', sha256='4d07f5c6102f06999d8cfdb1d17f5b59f9f2b804697f14b3bc562e3ea094b8a8')
```

**with** 
```
    git      = "https://github.com/dftbplus/dftbplus.git"
    version('19.1', tag='19.1', submodules=True)
```

**Now it's working on my Ubuntu 18.04 system. Please update the `dftbplus` package system.** 

Additionally, please add the following packages: `m4`, `blas`, `lapack` into the `dftbplus` package dependency. Otherwise it won't successfully build. 

### General information

<!-- These boxes can be checked by replacing [ ] with [x] or by clicking them after submitting the issue. -->
- [ ] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have run `spack maintainers <name-of-the-package>` and @mentioned any maintainers
- [ ] I have uploaded the build log and environment files
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
